input2:
Patient with h/o metastatic SCLC to theliver and brain (most recently C2D1 carboplatin AUC 5 + etoposide) on outpatient CT for progression evaluation. Referred in for admission for anticoagulation management. Patient has no complaints, including no CP, SOB,dizziness, cough. No pain w/ deep inspiration or calf pain/tenderness. Pt did not wish to be hospitalized. 
﻿
input3:
PMH/PSH:
- Stroke years ago with mild left residual weakness,
although he is able to ambulate without assistant with a cane. 
- DVT perisurgically years ago, 
- MUGA (per med records: patient and his family is not aware)
- COPD (per med records: patient and his family is not aware)
﻿
input4:
Mother passed away a few months ago. Father deceased from complications of acute appendicitis. The rest of the family history is unknown. He denied any known diagnosis of cancer in the family.
﻿

﻿
b/l LENIs:
IMPRESSION:  No  lower  extremity  DVT.  
﻿
abd/pelvic CT:
1. Marked decrease in metastatic disease. Multiple 
metastatic lesions scattered throughout the liver  have  decreased in size.  Segment II lesion has decreased from 2.1 cm to 1.4 cm. Previous soft tissue metastasis adjacent to the bilateral kidneys and near the aortic bifurcation are not seen on this exam.    Pancreatic and gallbladder masses are not seen.  Left adrenal gland nodule has decreased from 1.7 cm to 0.9 cm.
2. Right adrenal gland nodule measuring 1.2 cm, stable .
﻿
chest CT with contrast:
IMPRESSION:
1. Substantial interval improvement of extensive left upper lobe mass, obstruction of the segmental bronchi of the left  upper lobe  and mediastinal lymphadenopathy as described.
2. Right lower lobe segmental and subsegmental emboli.  No evidence of the right heart strain.
3. Stable pulmonary nodules as well as pulmonary emphysema, mild asdescribed.
﻿
head MRI:
IMPRESSION: The previously metastatic lesions have decreased  in size and are less appreciated. No definite new lesions are seen.   
Otherwise, the examination is stable since the previous MRI.

The main and right pulmonary arteries are normal in caliber, and there is no evidence of right heart strain.
﻿
